verses.verse: Now <S%G1161><s%> concerning <S%G4012><s%> the things about which <S%G3739><s%> you wrote, <S%G1125><s%> it is good <S%G2570><s%> for a man <S%G444><s%> not to touch <S%G681><s%> a woman. <S%G1135><s%>

But because <S%G1223><s%> of immoralities, <S%G4202><s%> let each <S%G1538><s%> man <S%G1538><s%> have <S%G2192><s%> his own <S%G1438><s%> wife, <S%G1135><s%> and let each <S%G1538><s%> woman <S%G1135><s%> have <S%G2192><s%> her own <S%G2398><s%> husband. <S%G435><s%>
Let the husband <S%G435><s%> fulfill <S%G591><s%> his duty <S%G3782><s%> to his wife, <S%G1135><s%> and likewise <S%G3668><s%> also <S%G2532><s%> the wife <S%G1135><s%> to her husband. <S%G435><s%>

The wife <S%G1135><s%> does not have <S%G1850><s%> authority <S%G1850><s%> over <S%G1850><s%> her own <S%G2398><s%> body, <S%G4983><s%> but the husband <S%G435><s%> [does]; and likewise <S%G3668><s%> also <S%G2532><s%> the husband <S%G435><s%> does not have <S%G1850><s%> authority <S%G1850><s%> over <S%G1850><s%> his own <S%G2398><s%> body, <S%G4983><s%> but the wife <S%G1135><s%> [does.]

Stop <S%G3361><s%> depriving <S%G650><s%> one <S%G240><s%> another, <S%G240><s%> except <S%G1509><s%> by agreement <S%G4859><s%> for a time <S%G2540><s%> that you may devote <S%G4980><s%> yourselves <S%G4980><s%> to prayer, <S%G4335><s%> and come <S%G1510><s%> together <S%G1909><s%> <S%G3588><s%> <S%G846><s%> again <S%G3825><s%> lest <S%G2443><s%> <S%G3361><s%> Satan <S%G4567><s%> tempt <S%G3985><s%> you because <S%G1223><s%> of your lack <S%G192><s%> of self-control.
But this <S%G3778><s%> I say <S%G3004><s%> by way <S%G2596><s%> of concession, <S%G4774><s%> not of command. <S%G2003><s%>

Yet <S%G1161><s%> I wish <S%G2309><s%> that all <S%G3956><s%> men <S%G444><s%> were even <S%G2532><s%> as I myself <S%G1683><s%> am. However, <S%G235><s%> each <S%G1538><s%> man <S%G1538><s%> has <S%G2192><s%> his own <S%G2398><s%> gift <S%G5486><s%> from God, <S%G2316><s%> one <S%G3588><s%> <S%G3303><s%> in this <S%G3779><s%> manner, <S%G3779><s%> and another <S%G3739><s%> <S%G1161><s%> in that.
But I say <S%G3004><s%> to the unmarried <S%G22><s%> and to widows <S%G5503><s%> that it is good <S%G2570><s%> for them if <S%G1437><s%> they remain <S%G3306><s%> even <S%G2532><s%> as I.
But if <S%G1487><s%> they do not have <S%G1467><s%> self-control, let them marry; <S%G1060><s%> for it is better <S%G2909><s%> to marry <S%G1060><s%> than <S%G2228><s%> to burn. <S%G4448><s%>

But to the married <S%G1060><s%> I give <S%G3853><s%> instructions, <S%G3853><s%> not I, but the Lord, <S%G2962><s%> that the wife <S%G1135><s%> should not leave <S%G5563><s%> her husband <S%G435><s%>

(but if <S%G1437><s%> she does leave, <S%G5563><s%> let her remain <S%G3306><s%> unmarried, <S%G22><s%> or <S%G2228><s%> else <S%G2228><s%> be reconciled <S%G2644><s%> to her husband <S%G435><s%>), and that the husband <S%G435><s%> should not send <S%G863><s%> his wife <S%G1135><s%> away. <S%G863><s%>

But to the rest <S%G3062><s%> I say, <S%G3004><s%> not the Lord, <S%G2962><s%> that if <S%G1487><s%> any <S%G5100><s%> brother <S%G80><s%> has <S%G2192><s%> a wife <S%G1135><s%> who is an unbeliever, <S%G571><s%> and she consents <S%G4909><s%> to live <S%G3611><s%> with him, let him not send <S%G863><s%> her away. <S%G863><s%>

And a woman <S%G1135><s%> who <S%G3748><s%> has <S%G2192><s%> an unbelieving <S%G571><s%> husband, <S%G435><s%> and he consents <S%G4909><s%> to live <S%G3611><s%> with her, let her not send <S%G863><s%> her husband <S%G435><s%> away. <S%G863><s%>

For the unbelieving <S%G571><s%> husband <S%G435><s%> is sanctified <S%G37><s%> through <S%G1722><s%> his wife, <S%G1135><s%> and the unbelieving <S%G571><s%> wife <S%G1135><s%> is sanctified <S%G37><s%> through <S%G1722><s%> her believing <S%G80><s%> husband; <S%G80><s%> for otherwise <S%G1893><s%> your children <S%G5043><s%> are unclean, <S%G169><s%> but now <S%G3568><s%> they are holy. <S%G40><s%>

Yet <S%G1161><s%> if <S%G1487><s%> the unbelieving <S%G571><s%> one <S%G571><s%> leaves, <S%G5563><s%> let him leave; <S%G5563><s%> the brother <S%G80><s%> or <S%G2228><s%> the sister <S%G79><s%> is not under <S%G1402><s%> bondage <S%G1402><s%> in such <S%G5108><s%> [cases,] but God <S%G2316><s%> has called <S%G2564><s%> us to peace. <S%G1515><s%>

For how <S%G5101><s%> do you know, <S%G3609><s%> O wife, <S%G1135><s%> whether <S%G1487><s%> you will save <S%G4982><s%> your husband <S%G435><s%>? Or <S%G2228><s%> how <S%G5101><s%> do you know, <S%G3609><s%> O husband, <S%G435><s%> whether <S%G1487><s%> you will save <S%G4982><s%> your wife <S%G1135><s%>?

Only, <S%G1487><s%> <S%G3361><s%> as the Lord <S%G2962><s%> has assigned <S%G3307><s%> to each <S%G1538><s%> one, <S%G1538><s%> as God <S%G2316><s%> has called <S%G2564><s%> each, <S%G1538><s%> in this <S%G3779><s%> manner <S%G3779><s%> let him walk. <S%G4043><s%> And thus <S%G3779><s%> I direct <S%G1299><s%> in all <S%G3956><s%> the churches. <S%G1577><s%>

Was any <S%G5100><s%> man <S%G5100><s%> called <S%G2564><s%> [already] circumcised <S%G4059><s%>? Let him not become <S%G1986><s%> uncircumcised. <S%G1986><s%> Has anyone <S%G5100><s%> been called <S%G2564><s%> in uncircumcision <S%G203><s%>? Let him not be circumcised. <S%G4059><s%>

Circumcision <S%G4061><s%> is nothing, <S%G3762><s%> and uncircumcision <S%G203><s%> is nothing, <S%G3762><s%> but [what matters is] the keeping <S%G5084><s%> of the commandments <S%G1785><s%> of God. <S%G2316><s%>
Let each <S%G1538><s%> man <S%G1538><s%> remain <S%G3306><s%> in that condition <S%G2821><s%> in which <S%G3739><s%> he was called. <S%G2564><s%>

Were you called <S%G2564><s%> while a slave <S%G1401><s%>? Do not worry <S%G3199><s%> about it; but if <S%G1487><s%> you are able <S%G1410><s%> also <S%G2532><s%> to become <S%G1096><s%> free, <S%G1658><s%> rather <S%G3123><s%> do <S%G5530><s%> that.

For he who was called <S%G2564><s%> in the Lord <S%G2962><s%> while a slave, <S%G1401><s%> is the Lord's freedman; <S%G558><s%> likewise <S%G3668><s%> he who was called <S%G2564><s%> while free, <S%G1658><s%> is Christ's slave. <S%G1401><s%>
You were bought <S%G59><s%> with a price; <S%G5092><s%> do not become <S%G1096><s%> slaves <S%G1401><s%> of men. <S%G444><s%>
Brethren, <S%G80><s%> let each <S%G1538><s%> man <S%G1538><s%> remain <S%G3306><s%> with God <S%G2316><s%> in that [condition] in which <S%G3739><s%> he was called. <S%G2564><s%>

Now <S%G1161><s%> concerning <S%G4012><s%> virgins <S%G3933><s%> I have <S%G2192><s%> no <S%G3756><s%> command <S%G2003><s%> of the Lord, <S%G2962><s%> but I give <S%G1325><s%> an opinion <S%G1106><s%> as one who by the mercy <S%G1653><s%> of the Lord <S%G2962><s%> is trustworthy. <S%G4103><s%>

I think <S%G3543><s%> then <S%G3767><s%> that this <S%G3778><s%> is good <S%G2570><s%> in view <S%G1223><s%> of the present <S%G1764><s%> distress, <S%G318><s%> that it is good <S%G2570><s%> for a man <S%G444><s%> to remain <S%G1510><s%> as he is.

Are you bound <S%G1210><s%> to a wife <S%G1135><s%>? Do not seek <S%G2212><s%> to be released. <S%G3080><s%> Are you released <S%G3089><s%> from a wife <S%G1135><s%>? Do not seek <S%G2212><s%> a wife. <S%G1135><s%>

But if <S%G1437><s%> you should marry, <S%G1060><s%> you have not sinned; <S%G264><s%> and if <S%G1437><s%> a virgin <S%G3933><s%> should marry, <S%G1060><s%> she has not sinned. <S%G264><s%> Yet <S%G1161><s%> such <S%G5108><s%> will have <S%G2192><s%> trouble <S%G2347><s%> in this <S%G3588><s%> life, <S%G4561><s%> and I am trying to spare <S%G5339><s%> you.

But this <S%G3778><s%> I say, <S%G5346><s%> brethren, <S%G80><s%> the time <S%G2540><s%> has been <S%G1510><s%> shortened, <S%G4958><s%> so <S%G2443><s%> that from now <S%G3062><s%> on those <S%G3588><s%> who have <S%G2192><s%> wives <S%G1135><s%> should be as though <S%G5613><s%> they had <S%G2192><s%> none; <S%G3361><s%>

and those <S%G3588><s%> who weep, <S%G2799><s%> as though <S%G5613><s%> they did not weep; <S%G2799><s%> and those <S%G3588><s%> who rejoice, <S%G5463><s%> as though <S%G5613><s%> they did not rejoice; <S%G5463><s%> and those <S%G3588><s%> who buy, <S%G59><s%> as though <S%G5613><s%> they did not possess; <S%G2722><s%>

and those <S%G3588><s%> who use <S%G5530><s%> the world, <S%G2889><s%> as though <S%G5613><s%> they did not make <S%G2710><s%> full <S%G2710><s%> use <S%G2710><s%> of it; for the form <S%G4976><s%> of this <S%G3778><s%> world <S%G2889><s%> is passing <S%G3855><s%> away. <S%G3855><s%>

But I want <S%G2309><s%> you to be free <S%G275><s%> from concern. <S%G275><s%> One who is unmarried <S%G22><s%> is concerned <S%G3309><s%> about the things of the Lord, <S%G2962><s%> how <S%G4459><s%> he may please <S%G700><s%> the Lord; <S%G2962><s%>
but one who is married <S%G1060><s%> is concerned <S%G3309><s%> about the things of the world, <S%G2889><s%> how <S%G4459><s%> he may please <S%G700><s%> his wife, <S%G1135><s%>

and [his interests] are divided. <S%G3307><s%> And the woman <S%G1135><s%> who is unmarried, <S%G22><s%> and the virgin, <S%G3933><s%> is concerned <S%G3309><s%> about the things of the Lord, <S%G2962><s%> that she may be holy <S%G40><s%> both <S%G2532><s%> in body <S%G4983><s%> and spirit; <S%G4151><s%> but one who is married <S%G1060><s%> is concerned <S%G3309><s%> about the things of the world, <S%G2889><s%> how <S%G4459><s%> she may please <S%G700><s%> her husband. <S%G435><s%>

And this <S%G3778><s%> I say <S%G3004><s%> for your own <S%G846><s%> benefit; <S%G4851><s%> not to put <S%G1911><s%> a restraint <S%G1029><s%> upon you, but to promote <S%G4314><s%> what <S%G2158><s%> is seemly, <S%G2158><s%> and [to secure] undistracted <S%G563><s%> devotion <S%G7086><s%> to the Lord. <S%G2962><s%>

But if <S%G1487><s%> any <S%G5100><s%> man <S%G5100><s%> thinks <S%G3543><s%> that he is acting <S%G807><s%> unbecomingly <S%G807><s%> toward <S%G1909><s%> his virgin <S%G3933><s%> [daughter,] if <S%G1437><s%> she should be of full <S%G5230><s%> age, <S%G5230><s%> and if it must <S%G3784><s%> be so, <S%G3779><s%> let him do <S%G4160><s%> what <S%G3739><s%> he wishes, <S%G2309><s%> he does not sin; <S%G264><s%> let her marry. <S%G1060><s%>

But he who <S%G3739><s%> stands <S%G2476><s%> firm <S%G1476><s%> in his heart, <S%G2588><s%> being <S%G2192><s%> under <S%G2192><s%> no <S%G3361><s%> constraint, <S%G318><s%> but has <S%G2192><s%> authority <S%G1849><s%> over <S%G4012><s%> his own <S%G2398><s%> will, <S%G2307><s%> and has decided <S%G2919><s%> this <S%G3778><s%> in his own <S%G2398><s%> heart, <S%G2588><s%> to keep <S%G5083><s%> his own <S%G1438><s%> virgin <S%G3933><s%> [daughter,] he will do <S%G4160><s%> well. <S%G2573><s%>

So <S%G5620><s%> then <S%G5620><s%> both <S%G2532><s%> he who gives <S%G7031><s%> his own <S%G1438><s%> virgin <S%G3933><s%> [daughter] in marriage <S%G7031><s%> does <S%G4160><s%> well, <S%G2573><s%> and he who does not give <S%G7031><s%> her in marriage <S%G7031><s%> will do <S%G4160><s%> better. <S%G2909><s%>

A wife <S%G1135><s%> is bound <S%G1210><s%> as long <S%G5550><s%> as her husband <S%G435><s%> lives; <S%G2198><s%> but if <S%G1437><s%> her husband <S%G435><s%> is dead, <S%G2837><s%> she is free <S%G1658><s%> to be married <S%G1060><s%> to whom <S%G3739><s%> she wishes, <S%G2309><s%> only <S%G3440><s%> in the Lord. <S%G2962><s%>

But in my opinion <S%G1106><s%> she is happier <S%G3107><s%> if <S%G1437><s%> she remains <S%G3306><s%> as she is; and I think <S%G1380><s%> that I also <S%G2532><s%> have <S%G2192><s%> the Spirit <S%G4151><s%> of God. <S%G2316><s%>
